verses.verse: But it happened after <S%H3117><s%> a while, <S%H3117><s%> in the time of wheat <S%H2406><s%> harvest, <S%H7105><s%> that Samson <S%H8123><s%> visited <S%H6485><s%> his wife <S%H802><s%> with a young goat; <S%H1423><s%> and he said, <S%H559><s%> "I will go in <S%H935><s%> to my wife <S%H802><s%> into the room. <S%H2315><s%>" But her father <S%H1><s%> wouldn't <S%H5414><s%> allow him to go in. <S%H935><s%>

Her father <S%H1><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "I most certainly <S%H559><s%> thought <S%H559><s%> that you had utterly <S%H8130><s%> hated <S%H8130><s%> her; <S%H5414><s%> therefore I gave her to your companion. <S%H4828><s%> Isn't <S%H6996><s%> her younger sister <S%H269><s%> more beautiful than she? <S%H2896><s%> Please take her, instead."
Samson <S%H8123><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to them, <S%H6471><s%> "This time I will be blameless <S%H5352><s%> in regard of the Philistines, <S%H6430><s%> when <S%H6213><s%> I harm them. <S%H7451><s%>"

Samson <S%H8123><s%> went <S%H3212><s%> and caught <S%H3920><s%> three <S%H7969><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> foxes, <S%H7776><s%> and took <S%H3947><s%> torches, <S%H3940><s%> and turned <S%H6437><s%> tail <S%H2180><s%> to tail, <S%H2180><s%> and put <S%H7760><s%> a <S%H259><s%> torch <S%H3940><s%> in the midst <S%H8432><s%> between every two <S%H8147><s%> tails. <S%H2180><s%>

When he had set <S%H1197><s%> the brands <S%H3940><s%> on fire, <S%H784><s%> he let them go <S%H7971><s%> into the standing grain <S%H7054><s%> of the Philistines, <S%H6430><s%> and burnt up <S%H1197><s%> both the shocks <S%H1430><s%> and the standing grain, <S%H7054><s%> and also the olive groves. <S%H2132><s%>

Then the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Who has done <S%H6213><s%> this? <S%H559><s%>" They said, "Samson, <S%H8123><s%> the son-in <S%H2860><s%>-law of the Timnite, <S%H8554><s%> because he has taken <S%H3947><s%> his wife, <S%H802><s%> and given <S%H5414><s%> her to his companion. <S%H4828><s%>" The Philistines <S%H6430><s%> came up, <S%H5927><s%> and burnt <S%H8313><s%> her and her father <S%H1><s%> with fire. <S%H784><s%>

Samson <S%H8123><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to them, <S%H518><s%> "If you behave <S%H6213><s%> like this, <S%H2063><s%> surely I will be avenged <S%H5358><s%> of you, <S%H310><s%> and after that I will cease. <S%H2308><s%>"

He struck <S%H5221><s%> them hip <S%H7785><s%> and <S%H5921><s%> thigh <S%H3409><s%> with a great <S%H1419><s%> slaughter: <S%H4347><s%> and he went down <S%H3381><s%> and lived <S%H3427><s%> in the cleft <S%H5585><s%> of the rock <S%H5553><s%> of Etam. <S%H5862><s%>
Then the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> went up, <S%H5927><s%> and encamped <S%H2583><s%> in Judah, <S%H3063><s%> and spread <S%H5203><s%> themselves in Lehi. <S%H3896><s%>

The men <S%H376><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Why have you come up <S%H5927><s%> against us? <S%H559><s%>" They said, "We have come up <S%H5927><s%> to bind <S%H631><s%> Samson, <S%H8123><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%> to him as he has done to us. <S%H6213><s%>"

Then three <S%H7969><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> men <S%H376><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> went <S%H3381><s%> down to the cleft <S%H5585><s%> of the rock <S%H5553><s%> of Etam, <S%H5862><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> to Samson, <S%H8123><s%> "Don't <S%H3045><s%> you know that the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> are rulers <S%H4910><s%> over us? <S%H6213><s%> What then is this that you have done to us? <S%H559><s%>" He said to them, <S%H6213><s%> "As they did to me, <S%H6213><s%> so have I done to them."

They said <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H3381><s%> "We have come down to bind <S%H631><s%> you, <S%H5414><s%> that we may deliver you into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the Philistines. <S%H6430><s%>" Samson <S%H8123><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to them, <S%H7650><s%> "Swear to me that you will not fall on me yourselves. <S%H6293><s%>"

They spoke <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H559><s%> saying, "No; <S%H631><s%> but we will bind you fast, <S%H631><s%> and deliver <S%H5414><s%> you into their hand; <S%H3027><s%> but surely <S%H4191><s%> we will not kill <S%H4191><s%> you. <S%H631><s%>" They bound him with two <S%H8147><s%> new <S%H2319><s%> ropes, <S%H5688><s%> and brought him up <S%H5927><s%> from the rock. <S%H5553><s%>

When he came <S%H935><s%> to Lehi, <S%H3896><s%> the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> shouted <S%H7321><s%> as <S%H7125><s%> they met him: <S%H7307><s%> and the Spirit of Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> came mightily <S%H6743><s%> on him, <S%H5688><s%> and the ropes that were on his arms <S%H2220><s%> became as flax <S%H6593><s%> that was burnt <S%H1197><s%> with fire, <S%H784><s%> and his bands <S%H612><s%> dropped <S%H4549><s%> from off his hands. <S%H3027><s%>

He found <S%H4672><s%> a fresh <S%H2961><s%> jawbone <S%H3895><s%> of a donkey, <S%H2543><s%> and put forth <S%H7971><s%> his hand, <S%H3027><s%> and took <S%H3947><s%> it, <S%H5221><s%> and struck a thousand <S%H505><s%> men therewith. <S%H376><s%>

Samson <S%H8123><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "With the jawbone <S%H3895><s%> of a donkey, <S%H2543><s%> heaps <S%H2565><s%> on heaps; <S%H2565><s%> with the jawbone <S%H3895><s%> of a donkey <S%H2543><s%> I have struck <S%H5221><s%> a thousand <S%H505><s%> men. <S%H376><s%>"

It happened, <S%H3615><s%> when he had made an end of speaking, <S%H1696><s%> that he cast away <S%H7993><s%> the jawbone <S%H3895><s%> out of his hand; <S%H3027><s%> and that place <S%H4725><s%> was called <S%H7121><s%> Ramath Lehi. <S%H7437><s%>

He was very <S%H3966><s%> thirsty, <S%H6770><s%> and called <S%H7121><s%> on Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "You have given <S%H5414><s%> this great <S%H1419><s%> deliverance <S%H8668><s%> by the hand <S%H3027><s%> of your servant; <S%H5650><s%> and now shall I die <S%H4191><s%> for thirst, <S%H6772><s%> and fall <S%H5307><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the uncircumcised? <S%H6189><s%>"

But God <S%H430><s%> split <S%H1234><s%> the hollow place <S%H4388><s%> that is in Lehi, <S%H3895><s%> and water <S%H4325><s%> came <S%H3318><s%> out of it. <S%H8354><s%> When he had drunk, his spirit <S%H7307><s%> came again, <S%H7725><s%> and he revived: <S%H2421><s%> therefore its name <S%H8034><s%> was called <S%H7121><s%> En Hakkore, <S%H5875><s%> which is in Lehi, <S%H3896><s%> to this day. <S%H3117><s%>
He judged <S%H8199><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> in the days <S%H3117><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> twenty <S%H6242><s%> years. <S%H8141><s%>
